1:
I decided, "I will watch what I say\q so that I do not sin with my tongue.
\q I will muzzle my mouth
\q while in the presence of an evil man."


\q
2:
I kept silent; I kept back my words even from saying anything good,\q and my pain grew worse.
\q
3:
My heart became hot;\q when I thought about these things, it burned like a fire.
\q Then finally I spoke.


\q
4:
"Yahweh, make me know when will be the end of my life\q and the extent of my days.
\q Show me how transient I am.
\q
5:
See, you have made my days only the width of my hand,\q and my lifetime is like nothing before you.
\q Surely every man is a single breath.
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
6:
Surely every man walks about like a shadow.\q Surely everyone hurries about
\q to accumulate riches although they do not know who will receive them.
\q
7:
Now, Lord, for what am I waiting?\q You are my only hope.


\q
8:
Rescue me from my sins;\q do not make me the reproach of fools.
\q
9:
I am silent and cannot open my mouth,\q because it is you who has done it. 


\q
10:
Stop wounding me;\q I am overwhelmed by the blow of your hand.
\q
11:
When you discipline people for sin,\q you consume the things they desire like a moth;
\q surely all people are nothing but vapor.
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
12:
Hear my prayer, Yahweh, and listen to me;\q listen to my weeping!
\q Do not be deaf to me,
\q for I am like a foreigner with you, a refugee like all my ancestors were.
\q
13: Turn your gaze from me so that I may smile again\q before I die."
